entry.title: Information Overload 2010-09-19
entry.content:
This week "Information Overload" is back in full swing, and there really were lots of interesting things I stumbled upon:

  • "The Biggest Company You've Never Heard Of":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=szNLMtgI7hU
    Interesting two and a half minute video about "Serco":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serco, a company I indeed never had heard of before.
  • "Goran Lindberg and Sweden's dark side":http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2010/aug/01/goran-lindberg-sweden-crime-palme
    Are "Stieg Larsson's":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stieg_Larsson novels closer to the truth than expectd?
  • "Third Kim lucky?":http://www.economist.com/node/16994770?story_id=16994770
    This article suggests that "Kim Jong-un":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jong-un will become "Kim Jong-il's":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_jong_il successor. I'd have expected a kind of military/party government after the latter's retirement/death, let's see what actually happens.
  • "Genetic Scars of the Holocaust: Children Suffer Too":http://www.time.com/time/health/article/0,8599,2016824,00.html
    "Epigenetics":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epigenetics in the context of Holocaust victims and their children.
  • "The Most Powerful Colors in the World":http://www.colourlovers.com/business/blog/2010/09/15/the-most-powerful-colors-in-the-world
    With so many colors to choose from, companies don't seem to be overly creative when deciding on their logos.
  • "Todesopfer rechter Gewalt":http://www.zeit.de/gesellschaft/zeitgeschehen/todesopfer-rechter-gewalt
    Interactive map of of people who died due to right-wing violence in Germany. Also see "137 Todesopfer rechter Gewalt":http://www.tagesspiegel.de/politik/rechtsextremismus/137-todesopfer-rechter-gewalt/1934424.html for more information on the victims (both in German).
  • "Itunes Remove duplicated songs":http://sergioveiga.com/index.php/2010/09/16/itunes-remove-duplicated-songs/
    It's always nice to see something based on my blog posts, especially in this case where it was the first time ever I wrote something about Erlang.
  • "The Myth of the Boy Wizard":http://blog.jgc.org/2010/09/myth-of-boy-wizard.html
    After the recently discovered flaw in "Haystack":http://www.haystacknetwork.com/, "Austin Heap":http://blog.austinheap.com/ got a lot of flak. This article is an interesting take on the media's role and responsibility in all of this.
  • "Zeros to heroes: 10 unlikely ideas that changed the world":http://www.newscientist.com/special/zeros-to-heroes-10-unlikely-ideas-that-changed-the-world
    A good reminder to keep on hacking despite the odds.
  • "Clojure is Fast":http://learnclojure.blogspot.com/2010/09/clojure-is-fast.html
    If you ever where curious just how fast you can get your Clojure code to run, this will provide some valuable insight.
  • "Lawsuit challenges Obama's power to kill citizens without due process":http://www.salon.com/news/opinion/glenn_greenwald/2010/08/30/assassinations/index.html
    You know a country is fucked once it needs a lawsuit like this.
